title: US visa curbs, AI surge shape cautious outlook for Indian IT in 2026
description: As India’s IT sector, valued at $280 billion, navigates its way toward 2026, it faces significant challenges such as stringent visa regulations and mounting global trade pressures. In response, businesses are pouring resources into artificial intelligence and developing global capability centers to enhance their international presence.

title: The Pentagon and AI giants have a weakness. Both need China's batteries, badly.
description: As the United States revs up its artificial intelligence sector and military capabilities, a concerning dependency on Chinese-made batteries emerges. This reliance threatens national security, prompting the government to shift focus toward bolstering local battery manufacturing.

title: Google’s Chess Master Is Working on AI's Killer App
description: You may have only recently heard about Demis Hassabis. He’s been named one of Time magazine’s “AI architects,” won a Nobel Prize for using the technology to predict protein folding and runs Google’s AI efforts. When the search giant acquired his company DeepMind in 2014, he embraced his new employer’s vast resources to build machines that surpassed human brainpower, so-called artificial general intelligence.

description: China's push to be a weather superpower has seen authorities accelerate efforts to end reliance on a European dataset, promoting a homegrown alternative for the era of artificial intelligence-fuelled forecasting.
